title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: The equity, child focus and adaptive capacity of Government national social protection programmes are strengthened., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, the most disadvantaged children, families and communities in remote rural areas and impoverished urban pockets have access to inclusive systems that protect them from poverty and enhance their ability to appropriately respond to emergencies and climate change risks.

participating-org.narrative: COUNCIL FOR THE WELFARE OF CHILDREN
DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS
DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND DEVELOPMENT CENTRAL OFFICE

mailing-address.narrative: 31st Floor Yuchengco Tower Rizal Commercial Banking Corporation (RCBC) Plaza 6819 Ayala Avenue corner Gil Puyat Avenue Makati City

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Data, research, M&E, and use of evidence on children with disabilities
Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

related-activity.ref: 3420/A0/06/004 SOCIAL POLICY AND GOVERNANCE FOR CHILD RIGHTS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The equity, child focus and adaptive capacity of Government national social protection programmes are strengthened.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government to strengthen the implementation of its large-scale social protection program, the Pantawid Pamilya Pilipino Program (4Ps), to be more child-sensitive and equity-focused. UNICEF supported the Government to generate critical and timely evidence to inform policy and program implementation adjustments of the 4Ps and the Modified Conditional Cash Transfer (MCCT) Programs for Indigenous Peoples in Geographically Isolated and Disadvantaged Areas (IP GIDA) and Homeless Street Families (HSF). UNICEF support DSWD capability building activities, policy discussions and multi-stakeholder consultations that led to the formulation of important 4Ps policies, innovative program design components with expected significant impact on children-beneficiaries | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a new social protection program for children with disabilities
Evidence: Existence of data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (such as health, education, nutrition etc...)

baseline.value: 1 - There has been a partial assessment of part of the social protection system (such as evaluation of a major programme) including a focus on child outcomes in the past 5 years.

actual.value: 2020:In light of the COVID19 pandemic, the assessment of the impact of 4Ps on child poverty is refocused as the COVID19 Child Poverty Effects and Assessment of the Efficacy of Social Protection Responses (inclusive of 4Ps) to make it highly relevant to the current context and inform immediate COVID19 pol

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Operational mechanisms are strengthened to adapt and/or expand in a timely manner during crisis (targeting and registration, MIS, coordination, monitoring, cash delivery system, complaints, communication, linking with complementary services, HR capacity)

target.value: 2023:Level 2 (SP systems adapted to allow channelling of assistance to disaster victims)

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Shock-responsive SP: Policy/strategy is adapted to support appropriate and timely vertical and/or horizontal expansion expansion of the existing social protection systems during crisis by government and/or humanitarian agencies (Linking with early warning systems, climate change and resilience building policies, contingency budgeting and financing etc.)

target.value: 2023:Level 2 (existence of policy mandating the use of EUCT in BARMM)

title.narrative: Contribution to a policy change that protects child rights and advances the needs of the most vulnerable children during COVID-19 (Yes/No) [COVID].

actual.value: 2020:No. Evidence generation is underway (ie assessment of the socioeconomic impact of COVID on households with children on containment measures for COVID19).
